intro: Galium verum var. luteum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
